summary: Email correspondence from attorney Teri Gibbs to federal prosecutors regarding scheduling interviews for two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in June 2004. The email includes a request to review photographs of the clients from 2004 against photos seized from Epstein's home.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney sending email to federal prosecutors to schedule interviews for two clients who believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in 2004.

persons.name: Lisa Bloou
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein, involved in case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).

persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein, involved in case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), alleged to have assaulted the attorney's clients in 2004.

events.title: Scheduled victim interview

keyFacts: Two new alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein came forward in August 2019, represented by attorney Teri Gibbs, claiming assaults in June 2004.
The attorney provided photographs of the clients from 2004 and requested prosecutors compare them to photos seized from Epstein's home.
The correspondence is part of criminal case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB) against Jeffrey Epstein.
The email shows coordination between victim attorneys and federal prosecutors (Lisa Bloou, Arick Fudali, Colleen Mullen) in the Epstein investigation.
The document indicates ongoing investigation and victim interviews in August 2019, shortly before Epstein's death.
